title: How to make table of acronyms/abbreviations in Word

json.text: hello youtubers this is the360fun & in today's tutorial we are going to talking about

making table of acronyms or
abbreviations in microsoft office word

microsoft office word doesn't provide us
with the facility to make table of

acronyms inbuilt so we're gonna use a
trick to make that happen

suppose you have the word EG which is
the shortened form so you will first

select this then we'll be heading to
references and beside references

there's an option where you
can see they have written marked

citation we're gonna click that and
inside the selected text we are going to add a

colon symbol and write the full form of
your abbreviation and then after that

I'll be clicking on mark and we're gonna
close this &  you need to follow the

similar procedure for other words or
the abbreviations and acronyms and now

i'm gonna remove this paragraph style
show/hide and now we're gonna go back to

references and click on insert table of
authorities and after that you can

select the type of format, tab leader and
other things and after that I'll be

clicking on okay and so you have got
your table or abbreviation this cases

thing can be changed to abbreviations or
acronyms and can be edited as per your convenience
